page.title: 09A DAY IN THE LIFE OF A VICAR
page.content: We decided to go and interview the vicar of{Cottingley.}We went down to his house one morning and collected this information: on a typical week day, he gets up at 8.30 and goes to church for his morning prayers. Either he or his wife then takes the children to school. There are then several things that he might do in the morning: go to meetings; write letters; prepare church services; visit people at home or in hospital; or go shopping for the church and his family. Then together they have lunch. After lunch, he usually goes to visit people. One afternoon a week he visits local hospitals. Most of the sick patients he visits are too old even to talk. In amongst all this, he has to find time to look after the children and his garden.
